qas.question: What capacity is public transport operating at?
How many people are allowed in a vehicle if they are not from the same family?
What will the authorities do when they stop your vehicle?

answers.text: enquire about the reason for the journey.

qas.question: When using public transport, how often should you wear a mask?

answers.text: You should wear a mask at all times

qas.question: From what date is public transport operating at a restricted capacity from?

paragraphs.context: Public transport, including the metro and bus services, operates with a restricted 75% capacity from 3 October 2021. You should wear a mask at all times when using these services. No more than four people are allowed in a vehicle, if they are not part of the same family. The authorities may also stop vehicles to enquire about the reason for the journey.

qas.question: From 3rd october 2021, what is the requirement about wearing face masks?

answers.text: the requirement to wear facemasks has been relaxed in certain conditions.

qas.question: What are the rules about wearing face masks in shopping malls?

answers.text: You are still required to wear facemasks

qas.question: What are the rules for wearing a face mask at public events?

answers.text: It is no longer a requirement to wear your mask

paragraphs.context: With effect from 3 October 2021, the requirement to wear facemasks has been relaxed in certain conditions. It is no longer a requirement to wear your mask in open spaces, except when attending organised public events such as markets. You are still required to wear facemasks in places such as mosques, hospitals, schools/universities and shopping malls.

qas.question: What is the maximum number of people that can gather in outdoor spaces?

paragraphs.context: Outdoors, a maximum of 50 vaccinated people can gather in a group

qas.question: For residents returning to qatar, what are the quarantine rules if i have had a vaccine?

answers.text: all residents returning to Qatar will be exempt from quarantine

qas.question: What do you need from the departing country upon arriving in qatar?
How many days ago does the vaccine dose need to have been given to gain entry to qatar?

paragraphs.context: From 25 April 2021, all residents returning to Qatar will be exempt from quarantine provided they have completed a vaccination course as recognised by MoPH Qatar (namely Pfizer/BioNTech, Moderna, AstraZeneca or Johnson & Johnson), their last vaccination dose having been administered 14 days prior to entry to Qatar and are able to provide a negative PCR test certificate recognised by the Health Department in the departing country.

qas.question: Which test do i have to take upon arrival in qatar?
When does an unvaccinated traveller take a pcr test upon arriving in qatar?
What are the rules for testing when leaving qatar?

answers.text: residents aged five and above are not required to take a PCR test before departing the country.

qas.question: For fully vaccinated citizens, within how many hours do they need to take a pcr test upoon arrival?

paragraphs.context: Fully vaccinated citizens, GCC citizens, and residents aged five and above are not required to take a PCR test before departing the country. However, they are required to take a PCR test within 36 hours of their arrival. Unvaccinated citizens, GCC citizens, and residents are required to take a PCR test within 72 hours prior to arrival and undergo a PCR test on the sixth day before being released from home quarantine on the seventh day of arrival.All other visitors, including vaccinated travelers, are required to take a PCR test 72 hours before arrival. Additionally, unvaccinated travelers are subjected to a PCR test on the sixth day before being released from home quarantine on the seventh day of arrival.

qas.question: Where do residents need to complete pre-registration for return to qatar?
When should pre-registration be completed for return to qatar?

paragraphs.context: it is recommended that all residents complete pre-registration for return to Qatar using the portal ehteraz.gov.qa ahead of travel

qas.question: Which tests do i need to take if i travel through the abu samra border crossing?

answers.text: a COVID-19 test and obtain a virus-free certificate

qas.question: When does the certificate need to be obtained?

answers.text: no more than 72 hours before travel.

paragraphs.context: Following the opening of the air, land and sea borders between Qatar and Saudi Arabia, all arrivals to Qatar from the Abu Samra border crossing are required to undergo a COVID-19 test and obtain a virus-free certificate no more than 72 hours before travel.
